contents: Article 6 (Promotion) ① Associate member organizations and recognized organizations are subject to promotion review after three years have elapsed from the date of approval for the relevant grade. However, if a recognized organization falls under Article 3, Paragraph 3, it is eligible for promotion even if 3 years have not passed. ② In order for a member sports organization to be promoted, it must meet the membership requirements of Article 3, Paragraph 1 and the number and grade of city/provincial sports organizations affiliated with the city/provincial sports association as set forth in the following items. 1. When a recognized organization is promoted to an associate member organization: 9 or more (the majority are at the associate member level or higher) 2. When an associate member organization is promoted to a regular member organization: 12 or more (the majority are at the associate member level or higher). However, in the case of Olympic Games events, the following items apply. go. In case of Summer Olympic Games: 6 or more (all at associate member level or higher) B. In the case of Winter Olympic Games events: 4 or more (all at associate member level or higher) ③ Notwithstanding paragraphs 1 and 2, the Sports Association excludes member sport organizations that fall under any of the following items from promotion. 1. If the previous evaluation result in accordance with Article 47-3 of the Member Sports Organization Regulations is the lowest grade. 2. If the member organization has caused social controversy and seriously violated the status of the Sports Association or hindered the development of sports. 3. Only after the management group is dissolved. If one year has not elapsed ④ An organization wishing to be promoted pursuant to paragraph 1 must submit the following documents to the Sports Council. 1. Application for promotion (Form No. 3 attached) 2. List of executives 3. Articles of association 4. Registration status of players, enthusiasts, and teams (including sports clubs) by city/province 5. City/provincial sports that have joined the member city/provincial sports association Current status of organizations 6. Performance of holding national competitions and winning international competitions 7. Current status of competitions hosted by city/provincial sports organizations (at least once a year) ⑤ The membership/grade deliberation committee comprehensively reviews promotion requirements, review opinions of sports associations, etc. The final decision on promotion must be reviewed, and the final decision on promotion shall be made in accordance with the following items. 1. Promotion to associate member organization: Resolution of the board of directors 2. Promotion to regular member organization: Resolution of the general meeting
